DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study examine feasibility acceptability family-based program improve physical activity tobacco outcomes small pilot middle school student family .
DOC.brief_title: Pilot-Testing Family-Based Intervention Improve Child Outcomes Increase Family Activity
DOC.detailed_description: Low income ethnic minority youth tend great risk obesity , physical inactivity , high risk behavior tobacco substance use result cardiovascular chronic disease . In study modify tobacco substance use risk prevention program develop tailor intervention ( Healthy Families DC ) also include promotion physical activity ( PA ) DC middle-school student referred school staff over-weight risk problem behavior . The program include initial family assessment , family feedback session family PA goal set 6 phone/text base booster session . A pilot study 18 family , comprise least one caregiver target child , conduct examine feasibility , acceptability , trend preliminary outcome PA via self-report accelerometry , health risk behavior ( e.g. , tobacco use ) , health goal setting , change family functioning ( e.g. , youth positive behavior , parent ) .
DOC.criteria: Students age 1216 year Attending regular education class three urban DC public middle school . Students must currently reside least one parent guardian wish also participate study . Students least one guardian must fluent English Adolescents , outside study age range Patients/parents unable speak/read English Are ward state Not attend regular education class public middle school Furthermore , adolescent guardian assenting/consenting study exclude .
